title: Creating a reading list on the process of reviewing research works and its biases is a great way to understand the intricacies and challenges of academic publishing
note: Here are 20 articles up to 2020 that you might find insightful:

title: **"Peer Review: A System Under Pressure"**
Discusses the challenges and pressures faced by the peer review system
**"The Secret Life of a Manuscript: The Story of a Paper from Submission to Publication"**
Provides an overview of the journey of a manuscript through the peer review process
Explores various biases that can affect the peer review process
**"The Effect of Blinding on the Quality of Peer Review"**
Investigates how blinding reviewers to authors' identities impacts review quality
**"Gender Bias in Scholarly Peer Review"** - eLife
Examines the presence of gender bias in the peer review process
Discusses how reviewers may be biased against novel research ideas
**"The Role of Peer Review in Scientific Publishing"**
container-title: Journal of the American Medical Association

title: Analyzes the importance and limitations of peer review in scientific publishing
**"Peer Review and the Acceptance of New Scientific Ideas"**
Looks at how peer review can influence the acceptance of new scientific concepts

container-title: **"The Impact of Open Peer Review on Quality of Reviews and on Reviewers' Recommendations"** - PLOS ONE

title: Studies the effects of open peer review on review quality and recommendations
**"Publication Bias in Clinical Trials"** - The Lancet
Discusses how publication bias can affect the reporting of clinical trial results
**"The Ethics of Peer Review: A Guide for Manuscript Reviewers"**
Provides ethical guidelines for reviewers in the peer review process
**"Peer Review: A Flawed Process at the Heart of Science and Journals"**
container-title: Journal of the Royal Society of Medicine

title: Critiques the peer review process and suggests potential improvements
**"The Effect of Conflict of Interest on the Peer Review Process"**
container-title: Journal of the American Medical Association

title: Examines how conflicts of interest can influence peer review outcomes
**"The Role of Peer Review in the Research Cycle"**
Discusses the integral role of peer review in the research and publication cycle
**"Bias in Peer Review: A Review and Meta-Analysis"**
publisher: Journal of the American Society for Information Science and Technology

title: Provides a comprehensive review and meta-analysis of bias in peer review
**"The Impact of Peer Review on the Scientific Process"**
Analyzes how peer review affects the scientific process and research dissemination
**"The Double-Blind Review Process: Problems and Solutions"**
Discusses the challenges and potential solutions for the double-blind review process
**"Peer Review: A Critical Inquiry"** - The BMJ
Critically examines the peer review process and its effectiveness
**"The Influence of Reviewers' Characteristics on the Peer Review Process"**
Investigates how reviewers' characteristics can impact the peer review process
**"The Future of Peer Review"**
Explores potential future developments and innovations in the peer review process

These articles provide a broad overview of the peer review process, its challenges, and the biases that can affect it. They also offer insights into potential improvements and future directions for peer review in academic publishing
